intro: Pupalia psilotrichoides, commonly known as the silverleaf pupalia, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, silver-white hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a leathery texture and a distinctive silvery appearance. Pupalia psilotrichoides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
